column4: GlaxoSmithKline lung drug fails to extend life in huge study
column5: GlaxoSmithKline's inhaled medicine Breo failed to prolong life in patients with chronic respiratory disease in a high-stakes clinical trial of 16 500 people  torpedoing hopes of a sales boost for the drug.

column4: UPDATE 3-GlaxoSmithKline lung drug fails to extend life in huge study
column5: * GSK shares down 1.5 pct; partner Theravance tumbles 15 pct   (Adds further reaction  details on drug sales)

column4: European shares boosted by Ryanair after profit forecast hike
column5: LONDON  Sept 9 European shares got a boost from a rally in Ryanair shares on Wednesday  which hit an all-time high after the airline lifted its full-year profit forecast by 25 percent.

column4: UPDATE 4-Nigeria financial markets suffer after JP Morgan index expulsion
column5: * JP Morgan evicts Nigeria from key emerging market bonds index

column4: Nigeria naira forward up 2.79 pct after JP Morgan bond moves
column5: LAGOS  Sept 9 The 1-year non-deliverable forwards (NDF) on Nigeria's naira rose 2.79 percent to 268.50 on Wednesday  a day after a surprise move by JP Morgan to eject the African nation from its government bond index  Thomson Reuters data showed.

column4: CFTC probes JPMorgan for alleged client steering: WSJ
column5: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) is investigating whether JPMorgan Chase & Co  is steering its private-banking clients to its own hedge-fund investment products without proper disclosures  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people close to the probe.

column4: MOVES-JPMorgan names Jonathan Cavenagh head of EM Asia FX Strategy
column5: Sept 9 JPMorgan Chase & Co appointed Jonathan Cavenagh as executive director and head of EM Asia FX Strategy.

column4: UPDATE 1-Texas judge issues restraining orders in Port Arthur refinery death
column5: HOUSTON  Sept 8 A Texas district judge issued temporary restraining orders on Tuesday to preserve evidence in the death of a bulldozer operator at Total SA's Port Arthur  Texas  refinery on Saturday  according to court documents.

column4: KKR to buy stake in Marshall Wace in hedge fund drive
column5: LONDON/BENGALURU American private equity firm KKR & Co  is buying a stake in European hedge fund operator Marshall Wace  raising its bets on the rapidly growing $3 trillion industry.

column4: REFILE-KKR to acquire 24.9 pct stake in UK hedge fund Marshall Wace

column4: Lockheed to cut about 500 jobs in IT services unit
column5: Lockheed Martin Corp  the maker of F-35 fighter jets  said it would cut about 500 jobs in its IT services unit by mid-November.

column5: Sept 9 Lockheed Martin Corp  the maker of F-35 fighter jets  said it would cut about 500 jobs in its IT services unit by mid-November.

column5: Sept 9 Lockheed Martin Corp said it would cut about 500 jobs in its information systems and global solutions business by mid-November.

column4: Lockheed Martin to lay off 500 in information systems  gov't services unit -source
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 9 Lockheed Martin Corp  will announce plans on Wednesday to lay off about 500 people across its information systems and government services division  which it plans to sell or spin off later this year  a person familiar with the plans said.

column4: Aerojet makes $2 billion offer for Lockheed-Boeing joint venture: sources
column5: WASHINGTON Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings Inc  submitted a $2 cash billion offer to buy United Launch Alliance (ULA)  a satellite launch provider jointly held by Lockheed Martin Corp  and Boeing Co   sources familiar with the matter said Tuesday  a deal that would further consolidate the space business.

column4: UPDATE 1-Manulife nears $400 mln deal to buy StanChart's HK pension business-sources

column4: Manulife nears $400 mln deal to buy StanChart's HK pension business-sources
column5: HONG KONG/SINGAPORE  Sept 9 Canadian insurer Manulife Financial Corp is nearing a deal to buy British bank Standard Chartered's Hong Kong pension business for about $400 million  people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

column4: Marathon Oil plans to cut 2016 budget by at least $600 million
column5: Sept 9 Marathon Oil Corp said on Wednesday it will slash its capital budget next year by at least $600 million  becoming one of the first U.S. shale companies to announce 2016 cuts due to low crude prices.

column4: McDonald's moving to 'cage-free' eggs in US  Canada over 10 years
column5: Sept 9 McDonald's Corp said all eggs it uses in its 16 000 restaurants in the United States and Canada will come from chickens that are not confined to cages within 10 years.

column4: McDonald's Japan posts first monthly sales rise since January 2014
column5: TOKYO The Japanese unit of McDonald's Corp  said on Wednesday its same-store sales in August rose for the first time since January 2014 helped by easy comparisons with the year before  when revelations of food-safety violations drove customers away.

column4: UPDATE 1-Russia's Mechel seals debt restructuring deal with VTB
column5: MOSCOW  Sept 9 Russian coal and steel producer Mechel has signed a debt restructuring deal with the country's second-largest state bank  VTB  leaving it one step away from reaching an agreement with all three of its main lenders.

column4: Russia's VTB restructures Mechel's 70 bln roubles debt
column5: MOSCOW  Sept 9 VTB Bank  Russia's second largest lender  has agreed to restructure debt of coal and steel producer Mechel worth 70 billion roubles ($1 billion)  the bank and the miner said on Wednesday.

column4: Peru bourse sees 'good chance' of keeping emerging market status
column5: LIMA  Sept 8 Peru's bourse has a "good chance" of staying in MSCI Inc's emerging market category and avoiding a downgrade to a riskier status  the bourse's general manager said on Tuesday following preliminary talks with the index provider.

column4: Palo Alto Networks posts biggest revenue rise in 10 quarters
column5: Cyber security company Palo Alto Networks Inc  reported its strongest revenue growth in 10 quarters and forecast better-than-expected growth in the current quarter as governments and companies spend more to protect themselves from cyber attacks.

column4: UPDATE 2-Palo Alto Networks posts biggest revenue rise in 10 quarters
column5: * Shares up 5 percent in extended trading   (Adds CEO and analyst comments  details; updates shares)

column4: Palo Alto revenue jumps as companies boost cyber security spending
column5: Sept 9 Cyber security company Palo Alto Networks Inc reported a 59.3 percent jump in quarterly revenue as companies and governments spent more to protect their networks amid  sophisticated cyber attacks.

column4: New United Continental chief moves to calm investors  employees
column5: One day after ousting its chief executive  United Continental Holdings Inc  and its new boss  Oscar Munoz  moved to reassure shareholders and employees that the company is stable.

column4: UPDATE 2-United Continental CEO sets new tone  shares rise on improved outlook
column5: Sept 9 United Continental Holdings Inc's  new chief executive  in his first communication to employees  promised to meet with as many workers as possible and "hear about operations directly from you " a sharp contrast with ousted predecessor Jeff Smisek that drew cheers from investors and unions on Wednesday.

column4: United Continental analysts welcome CEO change; shares flat
column5: Sept 9 Analysts on Wednesday gave the thumbs up to the replacement of United Continental Holdings Inc  Chief Executive Officer Jeff Smisek  who stepped down due to a federal probe of the U.S. airline  and the company's shares were flat.
